terraform.tfvars.example
files.content:
project_name = "echo-server"
environment  = "dev"
aws_region   = "us-east-1"

# Optional: GitHub OIDC role
enable_github_oidc = true
github_org         = "YOUR_GITHUB_ORG"
github_repo        = "YOUR_REPO_NAME"
github_branch      = "main"

# Node sizing
node_instance_types = ["t3.medium"]
node_desired_size   = 2
node_min_size       = 2
node_max_size       = 4

files.name: README.md
files.content:
# Terraform (ai_tf)

Provisions:
- VPC (public/private subnets, NAT)
- EKS cluster + managed node group
- ECR repository + lifecycle policy
- Optional VPC endpoints for ECR/S3/STS
- Optional GitHub Actions OIDC role (for ECR push + EKS describe)

## Usage

```bash
cd ai_tf
cp terraform.tfvars.example terraform.tfvars
# edit terraform.tfvars
terraform init
terraform validate
terraform plan
```

> Note: Deploying the Helm chart/app itself is intentionally left to your existing GitHub Actions workflow.
